info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:11PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN KENTON, NORTHWESTERN BRACKEN, SOUTHERN CAMPBELL, NORTHEASTERN GRANT, PENDLETON AND SOUTH CENTRAL CLERMONT COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM EDT... At 711 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Butler, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Falmouth, Claryville, Butler, Mentor, Moscow, Neville, Mount Auburn, Willow Grove, Grants Lick, Gubser Mill, Gardnersville, Peach Grove, White Villa, Ivor, Campbell County Lake, Fiskburg, Goforth, Greenwood and Aspen Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
